tool.name: ImportSchemasAndDomains

param.name: gdb
param.dialogReference: An existing file geodatabase can be given, or a new one will be created at the path specified, to store the resulting feature classes and domains.

param.name: in_schemas
param.dialogReference: The input Excel file holding the point feature class schemas. This Excel file must have a separate, named sheet for each feature class. The first row will be the field names. Subsequent rows are used to hold representative example or dummy data that ensures the appropriate data type is assigned to each field.

param.name: in_domains
param.dialogReference: The input Excel file holding the domains. This Excel file must have a separate, named sheet for each domain. The first row will be the field names. Subsequent rows are used to hold representative example or dummy data that ensures the appropriate data type is assigned to each field. The name of the domain (sheet) must be identical to the name of the field to which it will be assigned.

tool.summary:
This tool takes input schema and domain Excel files, producing a point feature class or domain table for each sheet within them. The domains are then assigned to the appropriate fields within the feature classes.

An existing file geodatabase can be given as the first parameter, or a new one will be created at the path specified, to store the resulting feature classes and domains.
